title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, goals, and requirements for the AirPollutionCaptureTree system. This should include a detailed analysis of the problem space, stakeholder needs, technical constraints, and any relevant regulations or standards. Identify the key components and subsystems required, such as the pollutant capture mechanism, structural design, energy management, and monitoring/control systems. Outline the expected performance metrics, scalability requirements, and maintenance considerations.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall architecture of the AirPollutionCaptureTree system, including the tree structure, air filtration mechanism, integration with urban environments, and data management and analysis components. Include details on modularity, scalability, and energy efficiency considerations.

title: Air Filtration Mechanism Development
description: Develop the air filtration mechanism that efficiently captures air pollutants and CO2.

title: Tree Structure Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the artificial tree-like structure that houses the air filtration mechanism.

title: Urban Integration and Deployment
description: Develop strategies and mechanisms for integrating the AirPollutionCaptureTree system into urban environments, including site selection, installation, and maintenance.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and perform thorough testing of the AirPollutionCaptureTree system, including unit tests, integration tests, and system tests.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Ensure the AirPollutionCaptureTree system adheres to relevant security standards and regulatory compliance requirements.

title: Documentation and User Guides
description: Develop comprehensive documentation and user guides for the AirPollutionCaptureTree system, including installation, operation, and maintenance instructions.
